data.title: Kayak Launch Locations
data.meta_description:
The #1 Kayak Guide & Gear Rental Service
in Southern Oregon
GUIDED KAYAK, & SNOWSHOE TOURS 
KAYAK RENTALS
GEAR RENTAL
data.text:
Located off Sun Mountain road in Fort Klamath,Oregon. This is the launch location for Kayak Tours and Shuttle Rentals for Sky Lakes Wilderness Adventures. The take-out is south off Sun Mountain Road about 3 miles at The Wood River Day Use Area.

DIRECTIONS:

When headed north on Highway 97 from Klamath Falls, Just before the Kla-Mo-Ya casino turns left at Highway 62 towards Crater Lake, follow until you pass the Crater Lake Resort on the right. Shortly after, you will turn right onto Sun Mountain Road. Follow until you pass Dixon Road. Shortly after Dixon you will turn left into Jackson F. Kimball State Park. There will be a Wilderness school right across from where the park is. If you miss the turn into the park, you will come to a gravel road that will tell you you have gone too far.

Located at the west end of Veterans Park in the west-side downtown area of the City of Klamath Falls

DIRECTIONS:

When on Highway 97 take the downtown Klamath Falls exit. Head east turn right past the veterans park onto George Nurse Way. The boat launch ramp is located on the west end of the park.

It is located off West Side Road, Oregon. This is the launch location for Kayak Tours and Shuttle Rentals for Sky Lakes Wilderness Adventures. This location can be the take-out or you can paddle south and take out at the Rocky Point public boat ramp.

DIRECTIONS:

When headed west on Highway 140 from Klamath Falls, turn right at the Rocky Point exit onto Westside Road (Highway 531) towards Crater Lake, follow westside and just pass the 11-mile marker sign turn right on a gravel road to Malone Springs. The gravel road will dead-end at the location.

Spring Creek Day Use Area is the launch and take-out location for Spring Creek Kayak Tours or Shuttle Rentals for Sky Lakes Wilderness Adventures.

This location is behind The Collier Logging Museum at Collier Memorial State Park.

DIRECTIONS:

When headed north on Highway 97 from Klamath Falls, turn left at The Collier Logging Museum. This turns onto Glendale St. Take this road behind the Logging Museum, stay to the right where the road forks, and you will end in the Spring Creek Day Use Area parking lot. It is about 1/4 mile off of Highway 97.

This is a remote rustic launch site onto the Sprague River without available facilities.

DIRECTIONS:

When headed north on Highway 97 from Klamath Falls, turn right at Highway 422 into Chiloquin. Go through town, and just after you cross the railroad tracks, turn left onto Sprague River Highway. Go 1 mile, then turn right onto Chiloquin Ridge Road in a short distance you will travel over a bridge that goes over the Sprague River. Keep going a short distance and turn left onto the dirt road between the highway and fence. Head back towards the bridge and the launch location is at the SE end of the bridge.

The take-out location for this Kayak run is located behind Chiloquin High School. It is a remote spot. Contact Sky Lakes Wilderness Adventures for the exact location to take out.

Collier Memorial State Park Rest Area is the launch location for the Williamson River Run #1 Kayak Tours or Shuttle Rentals for Sky Lakes Wilderness Adventures.

This location is right across Highway 97 from Collier Memorial Logging Museum

DIRECTIONS:

When headed north on Highway 97 from Klamath Falls, a few miles past the Chiloquin turn off, turn right into the Collier Memorial State Park Rest Area located directly across from The Logging Museum. The further end of the parking area just past the restrooms is where we launch.

The Williamson River County Access Park is the launch location for the Williamson River Run #2 Kayak Tours or Shuttle Rentals for Sky Lakes Wilderness Adventures.

This location is across from Dollar General and The Chiloquin Airport off Highway 422.

DIRECTIONS:

When headed north on Highway 97 from Klamath Falls, turn right onto 422, the Chiloquin turn off, About 1/8 mile turn right at the Williamson River Access location.
